auction package¶

Submodules¶

auction.auction module¶

This module contains the Auction class used to decode an auction

class auction.auction.Auction(data='', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: auction.json_obj.JsonObj

Class to represent an auction. E.g. {

“site”: “houseofcheese.com”, “units”: [“banner”, “sidebar”], “bids”: [<Bid>]

}

site¶

str – Site name

units¶

list – List of unit names in this auction

bids¶

list – List of Bid objects in this auction

has_unit(unit_name)[source]¶

Method to determine if this auction has a unit named unit_name

bids

str – List of Bid objects in this auction

has_unit(unit_name)[source]

Method to determine if this auction has a unit named unit_name

Parameters:unit_name (str) – Unit name
Returns:True if this auction has a unit with name unit_name, False otherwise
Return type:bool
site

str – Site name

units

list – List of unit names in this auction

auction.bid module¶

This module contains the Bid class used to decode an auction bid

class auction.bid.Bid(data='', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: auction.json_obj.JsonObj

Class to represent an auction bid. E.g.: {

“bidder”: “AUCT”, “unit”: “banner”, “bid”: 35

}

str – Auction unit name

bid¶

float – Bid amount

float – Bid amount

bidder

auction.bidder module¶

This module contains the Bidder class used to decode a bidder configuration

class auction.bidder.Bidder(data='', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: auction.json_obj.JsonObj

Class to represent a bidder as defined in config.json. E.g.: {

“name”: “AUCT”, “adjustment”: -0.0625

}

name¶

str – Bidder name

adjustment¶

float – Bidder adjustment

adjustment

str – Bidder adjustment

name

str – Bidder name

auction.config module¶

This module contains the Config class used to decode data in config.json

class auction.config.Config(data='', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: auction.json_obj.JsonObj

Class used to decode data in config.json. This class uses the Site and Bidder JsonObj decoders to decode bidder and site elements from the configuration data. E.g.: {

“sites”: [<Site>], “bidders”: [<Bidder>]

}

sites¶

list – List of Site objects in this config

bidders¶

list – List of Bidder objects in this config

has_site(site_name)[source]¶

Method to determine if this configuration has a site named site_name

has_bidder(bidder_name)[source]¶

Method to determine if this configuration has a bidder named bidder_name

get_adjustment(bidder_name)[source]¶

Method to get the adjustment value for a bidder

get_site(site_name)[source]¶

Method to get a site object by name

bidders

list – List of Bidder objects in this config

Method to get the adjustment value for a bidder

Parameters:bidder_name (str) – Bidder name
Returns:Bidder adjustment value
Return type:float
get_site(site_name)[source]

Method to get a site object matching site_name

Parameters:site_name (str) – Site name
Returns:Site object with name site_name
Return type:obj:Site

Method to determine if this config has a bidder named bidder_name

Parameters:bidder_name (str) – Bidder name
Returns:True if this config has a bidder with name bidder_name, False otherwise
Return type:bool

auction.json_obj module¶

This module is used to decode/encode json

class auction.json_obj.JsonObj(data, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: json.encoder.JSONEncoder

Class to abstract custom json object decoding/encoding. Inherits from json.JSONEncoder

data¶

dict – A dictionary of Python decoded objects

properties¶

dict – A dictionary of Python class properties used to identify this class object

loads(class_name, json_str)[source]¶

Static method to deserialize json_str (a str, bytes or bytearray instance containing a JSON document) to a Python object of type class_name

dumps(class_name, json_dict)[source]¶

Static method to serialize json_dict with objects of type class_name to a JSON formatted str

data

dict – A dictionary of Python decoded objects

static dumps(class_name, json_dict)[source]

Static method to serialize json_dict with objects of type class_name to a JSON formatted str

Parameters:
  • class_name (str) – Class to serialise additional types
  • json_dict (dict) – A str, bytes or bytearray instance containing a JSON document
Returns:

JSON formatted str
Return type:

str
static loads(class_name, json_str)[source]

Static method to to deserialize json_str (a str, bytes or bytearray instance containing a JSON document) to a Python object of type class_name. This method uses object_hook parameter in json.loads to do the parsing of custom JsonObj type classes

Parameters:
  • class_name (str) – Class used to decode additional Python objects (e.g. bid objects)
  • json_str (str) – A str, bytes or bytearray instance containing a JSON document
Returns:

Python dictionary containing python object elements
Return type:

dict
properties

dict – A dictionary of Python class properties used to identify this class object

auction.manager module¶

This module contains the AuctionManager class that stores configurations and runs auctions

class auction.manager.AuctionManager(config_json)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class that executes auctions based on a stored Config object

execute_auctions(auctions_json)[source]¶

Method to execute auctions, passed in as a json string, and return the corresponding results

execute_auctions(auctions_json)[source]

Method to execute individual auctions and to construct auction result objects. The return is a list of results as a json string.

Parameters:auctions_json (str) –

A json str instance containing the auctions to be executed. E.g.: ‘[

{
“site”: “houseofcheese.com”, “units”: [“banner”, “sidebar”], “bids”: [
{
“bidder”: “AUCT”, “unit”: “banner”, “bid”: 35

}, {

”bidder”: “BIDD”, “unit”: “sidebar”, “bid”: 60

}, {

”bidder”: “AUCT”, “unit”: “sidebar”, “bid”: 55

}

]

}

]’
Returns:A json str representing the auction results. E.g.: ‘[
[
{
“bidder”: “AUCT”, “bid”: 35, “unit”: “banner”

}, {

”bidder”: “BIDD”, “bid”: 60, “unit”: “sidebar”

}

]

’]
Return type:str

auction.result module¶

This module contains the Result class used to represent an auction result

class auction.result.Result(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: auction.json_obj.JsonObj

Class to represent an auction result. E.g. [<Bid>]

data¶

list – List of Bid objects

has_adjusted_bid(unit_name)[source]¶

Method to determine if this result has an adjusted bid for unit unit_name

new_bid(bid, adjusted_bid)[source]¶

Method to add a new bid to this result

data

list – Data containing a list of Bid objects

default(obj)[source]¶

Custom json encoder for this class. It encodes any Bid objects from Result.data attribute

Parameters:obj (object) – Python object
Returns:Serializable object for obj
Return type:str
has_adjusted_bid(unit_name)[source]

Method to determine if this result has an adjusted bid for unit unit_name

Parameters:unit_name (str) – Unit name
Returns:True if this result has an adjusted bid for unit unit_name, False otherwise
Return type:bool
new_bid(bid, adjusted_bid)[source]

Method to add a new bid to this result. For a bid to be added the adjusted_bid for this bid has to be greater than any existing adjusted bids for the same bid unit.

Parameters:
  • bid (:obj:Bid) – Bid object
  • adjusted_bid (float) – The adjusted bid value for this Bid

auction.site module¶

This module contains the Site class used to decode a site configuration

class auction.site.Site(data='', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: auction.json_obj.JsonObj

Class to represent an auction site as defined in config.json. E.g.: {

“name”: “houseofcheese.com”, “bidders”: [“AUCT”, “BIDD”], “floor”: 32

}

name¶

str – Site name

bidders¶

list – List of bidders allowed to bid on this site

floor¶

float – Minimum bid allowed on this site

has_bidder(bidder_name)[source]¶

Method to determine if this site has a bidder named bidder_name

bidders

list – List of bidders allowed to bid on this site

floor

float – Minimum bid allowed on this site

has_bidder(bidder_name)[source]

Method to determine if this site has a bidder named bidder

Parameters:bidder_name (str) – Bidder name
Returns:True if this Site has a bidder with name bidder_name, False otherwise
Return type:bool
name

str – Bidder name

auction.execute_auctions(auctions)[source]¶

Method to execute auctions and to print the results to screen

Parameters:auctions (str) – Auctions as a json string
